review: Wish I could say 2.5. This is not what I expected. I read the reviews about having to plug it in to the wall and I agree it is not a plus. My t.v. Is mounted on wall, all our other cords are hidden except this one. Now I have a black cord hanging down my wall. I would hide it with the others but I would like to use the fire stick on my other t.v. My other complaint is that the print is way to small on the screen at net flicks and Amazon streaming sites. I have 20/20 vision and a 40 inch t.v and can barley read titles or instructions. I will keep it because it was 40$ and I can use it on multiple tv's. I would look into a different product and spend a little more if I where to do it again.

review: I have a Roku box now and thought I would try the stick for comparison on another TV in our home that doesn't get cable.  I will update this after I play with it some more.PROs:Configured out of the box, linked to the purchasers account.Small and easy to move to other TVKindle Interface, still need to play with this a bit more.CONs:Disappointed in how geared it is to Amazon prime and the other channels are after thoughts.Too few channels in comparison to RokuThe search isn't across all channels like Roku.No Trailers, which is ODD since they are available on the Roku for Amazon Prime?The remote is also lacking, needs some more product testing.  Wish they would have asked us users who already are Prime members and have Kindle Fire devices.

review: Installation was easy, as was setup. Beats our Roku for ease of watching Amazon Prime media, but not as convenient to find new channels as the Roku. We used the included power adapter hooked up to the HDMI stick (a much needed third piece that the current picture of the remote and the stick does not depict). A short adapter was also included, so the stick does not have to be directly sticking out of the tv.
author: Frank "silverdew7"

review: A good and inexpensive Netflix / Prime set-top-box dongle. For some reason, it won't use 1080p on my TV (Vizio), defaulting to 720p, and I had some network stuttering issues on the first day (which didn't occur on my other devices). The Netflix App's performance feels a little slower than my Gen2 AppleTV which died, but a little faster than Netflix on the XBox360. For the price, it's more than acceptable though.Setup was a breeze, except they force you to watch the intro video. The controller is quite ergonomic. Definitely consider this as a secondary / travel set top box. For now I'm using it as my primary, but I can see myself wanting to trade up (perhaps if there is a new AppleTV, or eventually to the big FireTV box).

author: Mary Lou Monica

review: This is a remarkable device. Easy to set up, works very well. The normal price is good, and the Prime promotional introductory price of $19 was a real deal. My only objection is Amazon's choice of omitting Vudu from the available apps, since I have a large collection of movies that I have bought and stored in the cloud in my UltraViolet account and have been accessing them through Vudu on my Roku players. Fortunately. as other reviewers have pointed out, there are work-arounds. I have now linked my UV account to CinemaNow (available on my BluRay player) and Flixster (available on the Fire Stick). The picture quality of Flixster is the worst of the three, but it's acceptable.I have tried ChromeCast (OK, but a little awkward) and Roku Stick (never did get it to work and returned it), and the Fire Stick works much better for me. If Vudu were available on the Fire Stick, this review would have a raving 5 star rating.
